intro: Ononis vulgaris var. confusa, commonly known as the woolly catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
